summary.p: Has carried out what Myconius instructed him to do regarding the [Solothurn] "bandits". Sends copies of the statement submitted to the council concerning the upcoming convention in Saxony and the letter requested by Capito [to Capito and Bucer, No. 812]. Does not know what is to be decided [at the upcoming meeting] in Aarau. Sends greetings to Grynaeus and asks to be informed of everything. Is very busy. [The Zurich theologians] have recognized the Confessio Tetrapolitana.

div.p: Grace and peace from the Lord.
I have carried out what you instructed regarding the banished ones.
You have a copy of what we responded to our council concerning the Saxon convention. Capito requested that we write friendly letters. We have written them. Here you also have a copy of these.
We do not know what is being decided in Aarau. Pray to the Lord that all may turn out well.
Convey my greetings a thousand times to Grynaeus. You will share all this with him. Being very busy, I could not write more.
We can accept the confession of the four cities and we have accepted it.
To Lord Oswald Myconius, dearest brother. In Basel.
